description: Mexico is a vibrant North American destination that offers a compelling mix of modern amenities and traditional culture at a low cost. Its cost of living index (37.6) and affordable healthcare (Index: 72.7) make it a top tier choice for retirees. While it boasts a warm, tropical climate and a massive expat community of over 8 million, prospective residents must navigate a high corruption index (26) and moderate safety concerns (Index: 46.8). However, the wide availability of residency visas and proximity to the US remain major draws.

visas.name: Temporary Resident Visa
visas.description: This visa permits foreign nationals to enter Mexico and remain in the territory under temporary resident status for purposes specified by immigration law. The foreignerâ€™s purpose is to remain in Mexico for a period longer than 180 days and not longer than 4 years.
requirements: Must present at an authorized port of entry for foreign nationals whose purpose is to stay in Mexico under temporary resident status.

visas.name: Permanent Resident Visa
visas.description: A visa for foreign nationals who wish to enter Mexico as permanent residents; it grants indefinite residence status once issued.
requirements: Proof of legal stay if applicable (for those already in Mexico under temporary status).
Either proof of retired or pensioned status, or family unity (having Mexican citizen or legal permanent resident family member) or points-based eligibility.
Submission of the immigration application within the first 30 calendar days of entry under the visa.

visas.name: Temporary Resident Student Visa
visas.description: This visa is granted to foreign nationals who plan to enter Mexico as temporary resident students for studies lasting more than 180 days. It requires a valid passport, proof of legal stay if applicable, documents showing acceptance or enrollment in studies, and the completed visa application with a compliant photo.
requirements: Valid passport or travel document recognized under international law
Proof of legal stay, if the applicant is not a national of the country where the visa application is made
Proof of enrollment or acceptance at a recognized educational institution, or documentation showing participation under an international student-exchange or mobility agreement.
Completed visa application form, printed on a single sheet, double-sided.
